disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Saturday 23 April to end of Saturday 23 April GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Mostly cloudy on Saturday with some sunny intervals.<br/><br/>Air arriving locally in Greater London is forecast to have travelled on a path from eastern Europe across the north of the continent, through Poland, Germany the Baltic Sea and finally Belgium. There is likely to be some import of long-range particulates, however the air-stream is expected to be fast moving which will limit the potential for pollutants to accumulate en route. In addition, a fresh north-easterly breeze throughout the day should help disperse any local emissions.<br/>     <br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Sunday 24 April to end of Sunday 24 April GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Cloudy on Sunday with sunny intervals.<br/><br/>Air arriving in Greater London is forecast to have travelled on a path from Scandinavia via the North Sea. This air mass is expected to be relatively 'clean'. A fresh north-easterly breeze should also aid dispersion of any local emissions.<br/>     <br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>
